title: S&P financials index may be bruised but not without bright spots
text: Financial stocks have lagged the broader equity market since the start of the year and since the late March crisis-low. But not all stocks are created equal in the S&P index that tracks the industry, which is down 23% year-to-date.

title: Anxiety over elections is no-surprise, but stocks got crushed: BlackRock's Koesterich
text: Russ Koesterich, BlackRock Global Allocation Fund Portfolio Manager, joins 'Closing Bell' to give his take on the massive market plunge as daily coronavirus cases continue to surge in the U.S. and the country faces a possibly contested election result.

title: Jumping Ship: Profit-Taking Seen As Election Nears, Caseloads Rise, Stimulus Hopes Fade
text: One metric many traders are watching is virus-related hospitalizations. The caseloads continue ticking up here and in Europe, but if better treatments keep people from being hospitalized, that might be seen as positive for the market.

title: Dow plummets more than 900 points as S&P 500, Nasdaq turn negative for October
text: FOX Business' Ashley Webster reports the latest on the markets. #FoxBusiness Subscribe to Fox Business!

title: Stock Market Today: Dow Drops 943 Points as Investors Storm the Exits
text: So much for the market's best day of the year. Oct. 28, on average the S&P 500's best-performing day over the past 70 years, was instead one of 2020's worst as COVID-19 concerns continued to flare up in the U.S. and Europe.

title: 'This is not a secular, systematic decline': Jim Cramer on the sell-off
text: Stocks fell sharply Wednesday amid concerns over the latest increase in coronavirus cases and the impact on the global economy. The Dow dropped more than 900 points for its worst drop since June.

title: There's so much anxiety over vaccines and the election: Tusk Ventures CEO on sell-off
text: Bradley Tusk, Tusk Ventures CEO, joins 'Closing Bell' to weigh in on the market plunge. He talks about what might have caused today's scale of market sell-off.

title: Nancy Pelosi says the stock market slide could force Trump to quickly negotiate a large stimulus deal
text: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Wednesday that the recent stock market slide could push President Donald Trump to seek a large economic rescue package, given the importance he's always placed on it. "What the president cares a lot about is the stock market, and as he sees the market react to the spread of the virus and he sees the market react to the fact that we do not have an agreement which could inject resources into the economy, hopefully now he will come to the table in a serious way to crush the virus," she told MSNBC.

title: Pandemic's latest spread triggers surge in VIX 'fear gauge' for U.S. stocks
text: Wall Street's "fear gauge" is on track for its biggest weekly jump since March as investors worried about rising U.S. and European coronavirus cases, the lack of fiscal stimulus and uncertainty about the U.S. presidential election outcome.

title: Nightmare On Wall Street: It's Too Early To Buy Stocks (Or Anything Else)
text: This pandemic-recession's uncertainties overwhelm stock market fundamentals

title: 'It feels a bit like groundhog day': AlphaOmega's Cecchini on markets
text: AlphaOmega Advisors CEO Peter Cecchini joins 'Closing Bell' to talk about the state of the markets and his thoughts on European equities.

title: We don't need mandated shutdowns to see significant impact on the economy: Schwab's Sonders
text: Liz Ann Sonders, Charles Schwab chief investment strategist, joins 'Closing Bell' to talk about why we're seeing the markets plunge shortly before the election. Sonders says there are many catalysts causing this downturn, one of which would be the lack of fiscal stimulus from Congress.

title: The S&P 500 will tumble up to 20% now that investors have lost hope that COVID-19 would be controlled, an investment chief says
text: "The stock market is telling us that COVID-19 isn't going away anytime soon." That's according to James McDonald, Hercules Investments CEO and investment chief, who said on Wednesday that the S&P 500 index could tumble an additional 20% as cases of the coronavirus surge in the US and swaths of Europe begin to lock down again.

title: Dow craters 943 points in worst day since June as virus spike spurs new lockdowns
text: US stocks cratered on Wednesday amid a continued spike in COVID-19 cases that prompted a new wave of lockdowns in Europe. The Dow Jones industrial average's, 3.4% marked its worst single-day drop since June 11, while the S&P 500's 1.9% drop was its largest since Sept. 23.

title: Dow ends more than 900 points lower as blue-chip gauge falls for 4th straight day
text: Stocks fell sharply Wednesday, extending losses into the closing bell and bring the Dow Jones Industrial Average's losing streak to four sessions as investors grappled with rising COVID-19 cases that led to renewed lockdowns in France and Germany and underlined concerns about the U.S. economic recovery. The Dow fell around 942 points, or 3.4%, to finish near 26,521, according to preliminary figures, while the S&P 500 closed with a loss of around 119 points, or 3.5%, near 3,271.

title: A rollback or reformed Section 230 will impact venture capital activity around early stage platforms
text: The CEOs of Facebook, Google and Twitter defended their policies on Capitol Hill today. Alex Kantrowitz, founder of the Big Technology newsletter, a newsletter and podcast about Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Google and Microsoft, and Monique Woodard, Cake Ventures founding partner and managing director, join 'Closing Bell' to discuss their takeaways.

title: The length of the sell-off matters as much as the extent of the sell-off: Mohamed El-Erian
text: Mohamed El-Erian, Allianz chief economic advisor, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss what the spike in coronavirus cases in Europe and United States means for markets and the economic recovery. There's a 50/50 chance of Europe going into a recession, says El-Erian.

title: Is It Time To Return To The COVID Winners?
text: Traders are clearly in risk-off mode at the moment.

title: Stocks are hit hard by virus, election, and the next test will be Apple and Big Tech earnings
text: The market, selling off hard on rising virus cases and election uncertainty, faces another test Thursday when big tech reports earnings.

title: EU arms itself against U.S. and others in trade disputes
text: The European Union will arm itself with potential punitive tariffs against the United States and other rivals if they take advantage of World Trade Organization paralysis and refuse to settle trade disputes.

title: We believe we could see the economy slowing, but not a stall: Riverfront Investment Group's Felton
text: Rebecca Felton, Riverfront Investment Group senior portfolio manager, and Laura Kane, UBS Global Wealth Management, join 'Power Lunch' to discuss why they think the market is lower this week and the future of the U.S. economy.
